title: add markdown list folding, #57104
npm task detection finds nothing in multi-root workspace
body:
Issue Type: Bug 1. Open one npm project in a workspace, observe that npm tasks are detected 2. Add a second npm project to the workspace, observe that no npm tasks are detected at all Note: tried downgrading to 1.26.0, same problem there. I suspect this is a compatibility issue with some system/environmental update, as it broke for me on ~ Aug 30th. I had installed 1.26.1 on Aug 17th, and this was not broken initially then. I've tried launching with all extensions disabled and the problem persists. title: Allow extensions to use dark and light thumbnail icons
body: Issue Type: Feature Request Currently extensions need to provide a single icon thumbnail for their theme to work on dark and light backgrounds. Similarly to how we allow icons from within an extension to use dark and light icons, we should also allow extensions to use dark and light thumbnail icons. Here's an example where a single icon doesn't work: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35271042/45051917-3f379880-b03a-11e8-8c0d-cf6fa20265f0.png) VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.27.0-insider (7b9afc4196bda60b0facdf62cfc02815509b23d6, 2018-09-03T09:07:33.052Z) OS version: Darwin x64 17.7.0

title: Search results are truncated in the beginning
body:

title: Search input error should be cleared
body:
- Search for `\n` in regex mode
- Get red error popup, "Literal '\n' not supported"
- Clear the search input, or type something else
- The error is still there. It should go away when the search input is changed

title: Unable to terminate child process for node

title: Avoid extension host communication if possible
body: Run with `--logExtensionHostCommunication` or with code change for `LOG_EXTENSION_HOST_COMMUNICATION` * Create an empty folder * Create a text file * Enable auto save * Type one character Observe, as part of saving the extension host is invited to participate in saving, but this is a text file and there are no extensions that I have installed for formatting text files, nor do I have enabled the format on save setting.

title: CodeActions are very very chatty
body: Run with `--logExtensionHostCommunication` or with code change for `LOG_EXTENSION_HOST_COMMUNICATION` * Create an empty folder * Create a javascript file * Enable auto save * Type one character in the javascript file ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5047891/45038813-4ecad780-b062-11e8-8af7-8ebaa3ab38d6.png) Obseve, the renderer process asks **9 times** for code actions after typing one character.

title: Follow symlink / open original from explorer
body:
Since #11539, explorer indicates symlinks like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/101152/45038421-7b322400-b061-11e8-93cc-20897f78681d.png)

It would be nice to be able to navigate to the actual location quickly, either by a command in a context menu or something like Cmd+click on the arrow.

title: Settings not saved when using new installer
body:
We have written the needed data into your clipboard because it was too large to se Issue Type: Bug VSCode kept nagging me after the latest update to instead use the msi installer, and assured me it would not lose settings. On one machine I installed without removing the current version, and when it popped up a dialog warning me that I should first uninstall the old version, I chose to go ahead with the install, and ended up with both installed. On a second machine, I chose to listen to the dialog and first uninstall, but lost all of my settings. (I mainly notice that my keyboard shortcuts are reset to default). You might want to make your notifications a little more clear. VS Code version: Code 1.26.1 (493869ee8e8a846b0855873886fc79d480d342de, 2018-08-16T18:38:57.434Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17134

title: Debt - remove WinJS.Promise#timeout usage
body:
We have a winjs promise removal plan #53526 and nuking `timeout` is part of this effort. The following are alternatives

* [`async.ts#timeout`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/e2c151064eb935933c0bccae8fc3eaf0b8f54f4e/src/vs/base/common/async.ts#L364) for a promise that can be cancelled and chained
* [`setTimeout`](
http://mdn.beonex.com/en/DOM/window.setTimeout.html) for a simple timeout
* [`TimeoutTimer`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/e2c151064eb935933c0bccae8fc3eaf0b8f54f4e/src/vs/base/common/async.ts#L589) or various other utilities in the `async.ts` module

title: TypeScript Language Server and editor aren't synced correctly
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. --> 
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

Hi there,

my colleagues (cc @otbe) and I have some problems with the TypeScript Language Server. The problem appeared maybe around one or two months ago. We experienced the same issue occasionally independent from each other and thought it was _our_ setup, before we actually noticed that multiple developers here had the same issue. We thought it would be fixed in one of the next VS Code (Insiders) appears, because we thought it must was introduced by an earlier update. But after some weeks and updates the error is still here. So I began looking for problems like ours in the issue tracker, but besides several "TypeScript Language Server is slow" issues I haven't found something which matched our problem.

So without further ado, here is the problem:
We experience what looks like that VS Code and the TypeScript Language Server become out-of-sync. This doesn't happen every time, but once an hour or so. The errors than look like this and we need to restart the TS server to fix them. We write something like `abcde` in VS Code, but the Language Server only sees `abc`.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1152805/45029782-0dc6c900-b04a-11e8-9f3a-87d9142a6967.png)

Sadly we can't provide more information as we don't know why this happens 😔

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.27.0-insider (7b9afc4196bda60b0facdf62cfc02815509b23d6)
- OS Version: macOS 10.13.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Nothing deterministic. Sorry :(

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: SCSS parser have problems with trailing commas
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. --> 
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 
```
Version: 1.27.0-insider
Commit: 7b9afc4196bda60b0facdf62cfc02815509b23d6
Date: 2018-09-03T09:14:29.879Z
Electron: 2.0.7
Chrome: 61.0.3163.100
Node.js: 8.9.3
V8: 6.1.534.41
Architecture: x64
```

- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set language mode to scss
2. Paste following code 
```scss
@mixin m($a,) {            // [scss] variable name expected
  a: $a;                   // [scss] { expected
}                          // [scss] at-rule or selector expected

@function f($a,) {         // [scss] variable name expected
  @return $a + 1;          // [scss] unknown at rule @return
}                          // [scss] at-rule or selector expected

.foo {
  $test1: f(3,);           // [scss] expression expected
  @include m($test1,);     // [scss] expression expected
  $test2: f($a: 4,);       // [scss] expression expected
  @include m($a: $test2,); // [scss] expression expected
}
```
3. See the problems at problems tab or hover underlines
4. It compiles fine with node-sass:
```sh
$ ./node_modules/.bin/node-sass ./Untitled-1.scss
.foo {
  a: 4;
  a: 5; }
$ ./node_modules/.bin/node-sass -v
node-sass       4.9.3   (Wrapper)       [JavaScript]
libsass         3.5.4   (Sass Compiler) [C/C++]
```


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Git is very very chatty
body: Run with `--logExtensionHostCommunication` or with code change for `LOG_EXTENSION_HOST_COMMUNICATION` * Open a folder that uses git and has a single text file as modified * Open the text file * Have auto-save enabled * Type one character ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5047891/45025390-a6098180-b03b-11e8-99a0-d6c287ed9fc9.png) Observe there are very many SCM related messages even if nothing at all changes visually... - the status bar command is set to be the same - the count is set to be 1 (the same value it had before) - the context key `gitFreshRepository` is set to `false` (as it was before) - the status bar command is set to be the same x3 - it sends a change event for file decorations (which is incorrect/imprecise, the file is still modified) - decorations for 6 files are fetched again due to the previous imprecise event. - the content (or only the URL?) of the original file is fetched again which is incorrect because the index was not changed.

title: Files.WatcherExclude not reflecting the Settings.........
body:
I need to upload some image in src/assets folder. when I tried to upload an image, the page is getting refreshed. After that I came to know it is due to filewatching. So to avoid the folder from being watched I Created a workspace setting in .vscode/settings.json and made the following codes

    "files.watcherExclude": {
        "**/.git/objects/**": true,
        "**/.git/subtree-cache/**": true,
        "**/node_modules/*/**": true,
        "**/src/assets/**":true
    }

But sadly its not working.Still the Refresh is happening, Thanks in  advance.

title: HTML Entity Highlighting
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.26.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Prior to upgrading VS Code to v1.26.1 (Windows specific version), if I typed the ```&``` symbol in body text (in an HTML or PHP file) it would be highlighted in red prompting me to type the correct HTML entity ```&```. Since upgrading to VS Code 1.26.1 it no longer does this.

**Things to note:**
- I've tried the insiders version, issue is still apparent
- I've searched Google, SO and through the issues on here to no avail
- Disabled all extensions and still same behaviour
- Cannot seem to find a new/changed setting that may be causing this
- I've tried changing colour theme and still no luck

Any help much appreciated.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Store translation paths relative to the extensions directory
body:
Fix #54746

Store translation paths relative to the extensions directory

title: Remove artificial 500ms delay from symbol search
body:
Hi!

Currently, there's at least [500 ms delay](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/2c894f1998153dc700f63619ed32e94e843dc095/src/vs/workbench/parts/search/browser/openSymbolHandler.ts#L133) when searching for symbols. The delay is very noticeable, and makes VS Code feel slow, in contrast to IntelliJ, which pops up symbol search results immediately.

I suggest removing/reducing this delay, at least for cases where query string is not empty.

title: Allow to run multiple sessions on different display servers
body:
VSCode Version: 1.26.1
OS Version:  Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Run vncserver
2.  Connect to vncserver
3.  Run visual studio code from VNC
4.  Launch visual studio from outside VNC, and note new window appears in VNC

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

Steps to resolve:
1. The contents of the DISPLAY variable should be used in determining whether a running instance of code is a candidate for use.
